edu.rit.LightBikesClient

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • edu.rit.LightBikesClient.Grid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Grid
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Grid.java

    Assignment: Final Project

    Class: Rochester Institute of Technology, ISTE-121.01, 2155

    Professor: Michael Floeser

    Grid is used as the visible grid part of the GUI that the game is played on. Bike objects created by the Grid move across the visible grid once the game is started by calling the startGame method. Grid also establishes communication with the GameServer by creating an instance of NetworkConnector.

    Version:
    2016.04.11.v1
    Author:
    Felice Aprile, Justin W. Flory, Malcolm Jones, Timothy Endersby
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Bike object that the user of this client is controlling.

      Two-dimensional grid to keep track of which bikes have "claimed" which spots on the visible grid.

      Height used as a constant in calculating the size of the visible GUI and the grid array.

      Width used as a constant in calculating the size of the visible GUI and the grid array.

        public void startGame(int controlled)
        Adds bikes to grid and lets game begin. (Used by NetworkConnector)

                    java.lang.String username)
        Initiates a connection to the Game Server
        Parameters:
        hostname - The hostname or IPv4 address of the game server
        username - The username that this user would like to use

      • getServerBike

        public Bike getServerBike()
        Returns the Bike object that is being controlled by the remote player.

        This method is utilized by NetworkConnector to manipulate the Bike instance that is server-controlled.

        Returns:
        Bike object that this client is not controlling

      • getConnector

        public NetworkConnector getConnector()
        Returns the NetworkConnector instance created by the connect method for communication with the GameServer.
        Returns:
        The NetworkConnector instance created by this object.
